name: Use chain(s)
description:
Allows to use the given chain (registers it as a new executor) or a set of chains.
It is a loading-time function. So, you should reload the current chain for changes to these settings to take effect.

controls.caption: Chain JSON file(s)/folder(s)
controls.name: file
controls.description:
Path(s) to one or several chain JSON file or folders, containing chain JSON files, separated by ";". In a case of folders, each folder is scanned recursively, and all chain JSONs, found in the folder and its subfolders, become available to use.
Note: every path is trimmed, i.e. leading/trailing space characters, including line feeds, are removed. Thus, if you need several paths, separated by ";", you can place each path in a separate line.
You can use here relative paths (without starting "/" or "c:\"), for example, "test.dat" or "samples/test.dat". They will be resolved relative the current folder, containing the executed chain.
If this path starts with substring %TEMP%, %TEMP%/ or %TEMP%x. where x is OS-depended file separator character, this substring is replaced with the full path to the system temp directory (System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")) with ending file separator. For example, it is correct to write here %TEMP%my_file.dat, %TEMP%/my_file.dat or (in Windows) %TEMP%\my_file.dat.
Also you can use in this string Java system properties: "${name}", for example: "${java.io.tmpdir}", and executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}", "${resources}" (chain path/file name with/without extension, resource folder of the platform, containing this function).

controls.caption: Requires existing file/folder
controls.name: fileExistenceRequired
controls.description: If set, and if some of file(s)/folder(s), specified in the previous parameter, do not exists, this function throws an exception. If cleared, this function just ignores all non-existing files or folders.

controls.caption: Chain specification
controls.name: chainSpecification
controls.description: This argument is used only when "Chain JSON file(s)/folder(s)" above is an empty string. In this case, this argument must be a text, which is either entire chain JSON or a parent JSON, containing chain in the corresponding section. This chain will become available to use. This variant allows to use only 1 chain in a single call.

controls.caption: Execute isolated loading-time functions
controls.name: executeIsolatedLoadingTimeFunctions
controls.description:
If true, this function automatically execute all loading-time functions in the chain, if they have no connected input ports. In particular, it recursively executes all blocks with this function "Use chain". It can simplify development of complex chain sets. However, it is not necessary if you stores all chains of your project in some folder; then it is more simple to pass this whole folder in as "Chain JSON file/folder".
Note that the functions "Use settings" and "Use chain settings" are executed always, regardless this flag.

controls.caption: Override behaviour
controls.name: overrideBehaviour
controls.description:
If true, the following flags will affect the execution. If false, the behaviour is determined by options, stored in JSON file.
Note: you must reload this chain for the changes to take effect.

controls.caption: Multithreading
controls.name: multithreading
controls.description: New created chain (executor) will be executed in multithreading mode. (Ignored if "Override behaviour" flag is not set.)

controls.caption: Execute all blocks
controls.name: executeAll
controls.description: If set, this chain will be executed completely: all its blocks, even if some blocks are not necessary to make the resulting output. (Ignored if "Override behaviour" flag is not set.)
